bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, August 4, 1913

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to North Carolina to investigate malaria and propose control measures.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, August 4, 1913
div1.opener:
JKC MJM
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
August 4, 1913.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
United States Public Health Service,
U.S. Marine Hospital, Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
At the request of the State Board of Health of North
Carolina, you are hereby detailed to make a survey of the
prevalence of malaria, and advise with health authorities
and others regarding the means to be taken to control the
disease in that State, especially in Elizabeth City, Hart-
ford, Edenton, Plymouth, Washington, Greenville, Williams-
ton, Ahoskie, New Bern, Goldsboro, Tarboro and Roanoke
Rapids.

You will stop at Raleigh, North Carolina, en route
for conference with the State Board of Health, with the
view to securing the cooperation of the board in the survey
to be made.

A brief report of the progress of your work should be
made at the end of each week, all data collected to be
embodied in a final report to the Bureau.

Your status while on this detail will be that of special
-2-
temporary duty, and upon completion of the duty enjoined
you will rejoin your station at Baltimore, Maryland.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. pol
Ins
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
Shennan Allen
Assistant Secretary.
P D
